body: Devang, then we have a mistery because I don't get the same result using the same procedure. Look at my images. This is the analyzed box [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Fxq0VavCSuC-3kp1DVgaSe6jvpi7XcX6ACdOXa2lSslQaThLPvSkpibEntu8sFLerJt1v6PhrPC9J2oRieZcHnY*ePECar4f/1.jpg) this is the result [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Fxq0VavCSuAxst7rtN0r-j5wk37e8yREDKlOw3zBS1XVDUc6sh1kH4UNrwAABFFiVAOs5gk2tUIhJuS2kp8xvt8-fm0o2q1h/2.JPG) I see that you use a newer version Oct 31 of the 0.0.63 but I use the Aug 10. But I think is not this the problem. Anyway I don't really understand two things: 1 - what kind of measurement is this? You multiply the total sunlight hours by the surface area? This is not an average in my understanding, it look more like a total something. It would make more sense if you would divide the totals of sun light hours for the surface area, in this case it would be a sort of normalized quantity of sunlight hour per facade (h/m2). 2 - if it is not an average, then why the tooltip say "average" Francesco
